author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: NYPD says department is more diverse than ever
text:
The city's second-highest police official said Wednesday the percentage of minority hires has increased in the two most recent academy classes.
First Deputy Commissioner Benjamin Tucker told the City Council that almost 60% of the Police Academy classes from October and January are black, Hispanic and Asian.
In the class of 2013, 43% of cadets were people of color, Tucker said.
“Today, the department’s force is more diverse than at any time in its history,” he said.

More than 20% of the October and January classes were female, and at least 20% were born outside the U.S.
City residents made up 64% of those classes, and about 30% spoke a second language.
He also said more than 30% of promotions to captain and above have gone to minorities or women.
